website_summaries.verdict: Woodworkers in the know have no problem shelling out for this durable, precise router bit set. Hardwoods aren’t a problem for these tungsten bits. For cabinets and doors these are a must-have.
pros: Adjustable groove thickness adds versatility to projects
Extra-thick protective coating and longer bit life
Arrive sharp and ready to use
Experienced users rave about this router bit set, noting it is easy to set up and cuts smoothly
cons: Packaging is problematic as bits don’t stay still in shipping, inviting damage
Going slowly is imperative with these router bits, so they don’t heat up or cause damage
The spacers may need a bit of fiddling, some users noted, as they are not labeled

customer_reviews.title: These are the bits you are looking for
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice router bit set, and will let you do some very nice shaker doors. It comes with sufficient shims to setup and build great joints. Note, it does NOT come "dialed" in already, you will need to adjust the shims on one or the other to get it working right. As always with these types of bits, when doing the rail ends, you need to watch for chip out. I recommend routing a backer that you will use behind the piece as you move it through the router, to prevent the chip out.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Richards

customer_reviews.title: Bit exploded on low stress job, customer service lied about offering a replacement
customer_reviews.text: Broke after about 10 minutes of total use. Was using plain pine boards, no defects, totally normal. Tongue bit had it's teeth explode off and sent them flying. Clearly a manufacturing defect, which I would not leave a negative review if the company had handled it, but they promised to send a replacement and then never did and stopped responding to my emails. Terrible QC, terrible customer service. Bought a cheap bit elsewhere on Amazon and it's been working great. Total waste of money on this expensive one with a complete lack of customer support for their own defects.
customer_reviews.author: Tural

customer_reviews.title: Worked really well
customer_reviews.text: My husband was very pleased with the Freud Base Cap Router Bit. He used it on left over poplar, cherry, walnut, mahogany, and maple (it is all going to be painted white). He milled it in 3 passes through the router table, and it came out smooth without chattering or tear out. Check out the picture of how he set up his router table. He just needed to move forward the plywood with the rollerblade wheels to move it closer with each pass. It is going to be used for wainscoting for a 400 sq. foot room. We would definitely buy from Freud other bits because of it working so well.
customer_reviews.author: Living in Utah

customer_reviews.title: Great bit for cutting oversized fronts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bit as an alternative to the one Rockler offers in order to cut drawer locks in custom over-sized fronts in drawers. This allows a four piece drawer assembly rather than five. By using backer boards on the leading and trailing edges while cutting there is no tear out. I unknowingly purchased the Rockler set up gauge as part of the package which while being great for setting the height doesn't work for the over-sized front depth of cut. This has to be set by a trial and error method depending upon the reveal necessary. I'm very happy with the performance of the bit!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good router bit, sharp edges, well made.
customer_reviews.text: My husband bout this for a project he is working on. Actually, this his the second one. The first one arrived loose, bouncing around inside its case. So he sent it back for a replacement. A tool like this you do not want to take a chance on seeing how big it is and how fast it turns! This is a big router bit, heavy, well made. It is also very sharp. The instructions are mostly useless if you have never used this bit before. The setup block that you can get with it gets you close but the rest is trail and error until you get it dialed in. Once there, does what it was made to do well.
customer_reviews.author: The Boss

customer_reviews.title: Great bit to give professional look to window stool ends.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to finish route a few stools. I buy the pre-routed stuff by the foot at the lumber store, but after cutting to size, need to finish off the ends. This cutter is not exactly the profile of the story bought window stools, but close enough, provided you don't cut into the leading edge of the store bought stool. Straight and sharp, really sharp. Haven't quite figure out how to use the bearing on this thing. I use a fence setup and run the radius of the router base against the fence.
customer_reviews.author: fmwardalotTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Freud Rail and Stile sets are the best router based cutters
customer_reviews.text: I build custom cabinets full time, and own many different R&S sets from different manufactures. No question the Freuds are the best. I only use large shapers for panels, but I prefer 3 1/4 hp routers for my R&S setups, because I can keep a router dedicated to each profile. The Freud sets are my favorite because I can tweak the dados to match ply for flat panels. The longevity is on par with any other industrial cutters I use, and I can usually get it sharpened once without losing much fitment quality. I generally get several hundred doors worth of use out of each set so you really can't beat the value.
customer_reviews.author: Peter @Railandstilewoodworks

customer_reviews.title: great cutting, precise and easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality bit that you can adjust to the exact width of the panel you are inserting. However, whatever the thickness, give yourself at least 1/16 of wiggle room on the panel. I took it down to exact and almost split my stiles and rails trying to force it together with glue. The directions tell you that, but I thought I knew better.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: Glad I made the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Arriving at the end of my home renovations, I didn't want to cut corners on the last of my projects. Using these bits was very surprising. The cuts were smooth and very accurate. In the one, two and three star reviews, I worried about the comments mentioned about alignment and depth of cut. After I used the bits, I will chalk the poor reviews up to in-experience. Glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst quality bits I ever use, but good service from Freud and Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I always use Whiteside, Freud, Amana router bits and never have a problem. This one is the worst I ever use. After only 12 feet ash wood running on shaper with power feeder - two carbides just broke. It is a full fiasco for me. I have no clue what to do - call Freud, Amazon? Will try to call Amazon customer service. Update: Amazon and Freud were trying to help. Because windows of return expired, Amazon representative recommend call Freud company. And now I am in process to return and exchange this router bit set to a new one from Freud.
customer_reviews.author: Eduard Nemirovsky

customer_reviews.title: The best Tongue and Groove bits on the market
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt the Freud T&G 1/2" router bit set is the best on the market. These are fully adjustable bits allowing you to adjust both the width of the tongues and the grooves to a variety of widths. As an amateur woodworker, I thoroughly enjoyed building custom cabinets with professional results. I have recommended this set to a number of woodworking friends, and all have been impressed. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Colin G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, as expected from Freud.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this particular corner lock bit because of the previous reviews and the Freud reputation. It is also big enough that it covers all of the wood thicknesses I'd be using for projects with just the one bit. The bit is well-balanced and cuts very smoothly. The nature of this profile is that set up takes a bit of doing to get the two cuts to align perfectly. I made a new sacrificial guide fence so that I could embed the bit into the fence face. I am well pleased with this purchase and highly recommend this lock miter bit by Freud.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: factory packaging needs work
customer_reviews.text: Good product, but when I received these the toung bit had come free from its holder in the factory case an was banging against the groove bit. This would have been three stars if the carbide surface had been chipped, but ithey survived. The thickness adjustment is simple and blades cut through white oak "like butter". The balance on the tongue bit was a little off, enough that I would be concerned about running this too often in my router table, but not enough to worry if u use a shaper.
customer_reviews.author: JDub

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: My first foray into a drawer lock bit. I have traditionally done either finger joints or dovetails, but I needed a bunch of drawers quick so I decided to give it a try. I purchased the setup blocks and it works ok. There is a gap in the bottom of the joint once assembled, but it seems to work. Couldn't figure out how to close that up.
customer_reviews.author: Wood_fly

customer_reviews.title: Top quality bit set
customer_reviews.text: Just what I expected from Freud. Top quality product that performs exactly as needed. The included instructions could be expanded a bit, IMO. But the adjustments aren't rocket science and this bit set enabled me to turn out a really nice set of cabinet doors. If you haven't used these before I did learn one thing to pass along: Mill the rail ends first, before ripping the stock to finished width. That eliminates the need to back up the rails to protect from tear-out.
customer_reviews.author: Kingbird

customer_reviews.title: Improper machining of bit set
customer_reviews.text: After several days of adjusting, readjusting, and shimming I failed being able to close a 0.005 inch gap where the rail and stile meet on the profile side. All surfaces were flush and the joint closed perfectly on the back. I called Freud CS and they were pretty sure the grind was off so I returned the set. Disappointing. The bits cut great though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really helps to make the drawers square
customer_reviews.text: It took me some thinking to understand exactly how this bit works, but once I found the formula, I was able to make absolutely beautiful joints. The nifty part is that they inherently make the drawer square, so that as you fit the 4 sides to the bottom, it just comes out square without any extra operations. I may have been foolish, but I assembled slideouts for my kitchen with no glue, just these joints and the slots for the drawer bottom plus two pins at each corner. The assembly is remarkable stable and square. This interlocking features of this joint are inherently strong.
customer_reviews.author: David Brearley

customer_reviews.title: Good product but a pain to setup correctly.
customer_reviews.text: You need a set of dial calipers to perfectly and i do mean perfectly adjust your bit height if not you will have an offset. It comes with some instructions on how to setup your router but i found it difficult and went thru alot of scrap wood to get them set. Make a template for each wood thickness you need, 1/2, 3/4, etc, and use that as your guide block for setups later. remember to not change your planer setup or your setup blocks are useless as you just changed the thickness of your finished piece and your blocks are different.
customer_reviews.author: Euro_trash

customer_reviews.title: Carbide teeth came off
customer_reviews.text: Worked well until the carbide teeth came off half way through the job. I've contacted Freud through facebook and their website to see if I can buy just the replacement cutter, but no response from the company. Looking to see what other options there are for an adjustable slot cutter, and options are limited. Would love to have a little better customer support on this.
customer_reviews.author: beestingermom

customer_reviews.title: great bit, but difficult to set up
customer_reviews.text: After many tests I found out that for 3/4" stock, the top of the blade must be exactly 1" above the table. From there it should be easy to adjust for different stock. this bit is huge and heavy, I run it at the lowest speed my motor allows, 10K rpm. very smooth, no vibration despite the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate and worth the extra cost
customer_reviews.text: There are a number of these bits that are lower cost, but I didn't want to take a chance on the quality. I wasn't surprised that the Freud bit was very sharp and cuts very well. I don't know if the less expensive bits aren't as good, but I would definitely buy another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: GMisenar

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hesitate- these bits are amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these bits and 2 router tables. I run my cabinet side panels through horizontally and the cabinet stile through vertically. It takes a little trial and error to get it adjusted perfect but it’s definitely worth having 2 separate tables so they don’t need to be adjusted back and forth. I have built cabinet packages for 3 complete houses so far and the bits are still cutting perfectly. I wish I would have gotten into lock miters years ago- my cabinetry looks so much better with seamless corners.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: I might have given this item a 5 if they had given better instructions on how to use it, or if they offered a link to a jig or a video that would work. As it is, I have yet to use it successfully. I consider myself a moderately skilled woodworker. If or when I figure out how to use this bit, I may change my evaluation. It seems well-made.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Chipped Cutter Tooth
customer_reviews.text: New out of the box running test cuts on 3/4 Hickory stock(clean) and tooth on slot cutter portion fractured. See Photo. No more than 18 inches of stock removed before it failed. Unfortunate for me, had purchased 4 months ago in anticipation of a project and now way beyond Amazons return window and incredibly, Freud warranty is only 60 days. Cannot recommend based on product failure and lack of warranty longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Evans

customer_reviews.title: Clears the path
customer_reviews.text: As with all the Freud bits I own this one performs great. It clears away as little or as much material as you need for making draw locks. I've always used 1/2 inch shank type bits for bits this large and have never had a problem, and as other would tell you best results will come from using the proper router speed with bits this large.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Chipped a tooth first time on soft wood.....
customer_reviews.text: I received the item, and was immediately please and looking forward to putting them to use on an oncoming project, to build my son a dresser/changing table prior to his arrival. The first thing I did was make a setup block and made some test panels to assess fitment. I used Cypress, which is a soft wood, which was Virgin lumber. While removing the bit from my table mounted router, I noticed that one of the 4 teeth on the groove cutter had chipped..... Sadly, I was already out of the return/replace window, so I'm stuck with it now..... Which is why I gave two stars.
customer_reviews.author: The Stump Company

customer_reviews.title: Great bit set
customer_reviews.text: Ran a couple hundred feet of hard maple rail & stile for some cabinet doors through it so far - has held up well and produced very smooth edges. The included table for setting different gaps is very handy - I found that you pretty much need a micrometer to determine which spacers are which.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I used the bit immediately to join old cedar joists I had re-milled. I created a large countertop (1-7/8" thick) and just as advertised the joints were far stronger than the wood itself. I created a couple of beta counters at the same time and applied pressure until I broke them (after using them for other mock-up purposes of course.). Sure enough they eventually broke under several hundred pounds applied out at the end of the mounted counter but the break occurred dead center in the middle of one of the boards in each case (ie as far from the finger joint as possible.) Actually using the bit was smooth and easy and created a perfect fitting joint.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Lopucki

customer_reviews.title: Want the very best in woordworking bits and cutters....
customer_reviews.text: Freud bits are the bees knees when it comes to woodworking; they absolutely have no equal. I've been a woodworker and furniture maker for fifty years, the last thirty or so working exclusively with white oak and maple. These are very hard woods to work but the Freud bits just get it done. They have very hard carbide cutters which albeit are difficult to sharpen but last a long time between sharpenings. Go for the best; you will be glad you did..
customer_reviews.author: Gunther

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Product originally came with a chipped cutting edge, so had to replace it. The instructions are garbage... and the # of shims they tell you to install to achieve a desired tongue/groove thickness doesn’t actually result in that thickness... so it’s completely trial and error to get the thickness correct. It didn’t come with the number of each shim it was supposed to per the instructions (yes I checked with a caliper). Also, this bit tears out wood and chips much more than other tongue and groove bits that I have. Terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: I used these on relatively soft (and brittle) redwood and they worked great. I did over hundred linear feet with no apparent change in outcome. Maybe not the most strenuous test but they worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: A. Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Bits
customer_reviews.text: They come with a shim kit so you can make up any number of setups for tongue and groove thickness. I will try to follow up and give an idea as to longevity. At the first try they are performing well.
customer_reviews.author: Bob The Builder

customer_reviews.title: Great bit set
customer_reviews.text: Great bit set. I made a few doors with it after receiving it and it cut smooth as butter with zero tear out.
customer_reviews.author: Hoang Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Packaging problem fixed!!!
customer_reviews.text: Many buyers left negative comments complaining that the bits became loose causing damage to the cutting edges. I therefore hesitated buying these, but in the end decided to buy Freud because I have historically never had problems with their products. The packaging in which I received the bits holds them firmly in place (I had a hard time getting the bits out!). No more worries there! Freud being Freud, they most likely redesigned the enclosure. Now I'll be off making cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Benoit Legault

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bit!
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional woodworker and make a lot of my own mouldings on the router table. If you know anything about Freud you know they are a great company. This router bit is no exception. I have made my own base moulding in oak,maple,cherry,walnut, and even plywood with this bit and it comes out perfect every time. Knowing proper router technique is required in order to get perfect mouldings.
customer_reviews.author: stephen henley

customer_reviews.title: Typical Freud Quality
customer_reviews.text: I own dozens of Freud bits and blades and have faithfully used them for over 25 years. This one is just as good as the rest. Takes a little time to get it set up but once it is you can whip out a lot of quality drawers in a short amount of time!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I used this to build oversize shutter doors. I made the tongue 1 1/4" long for the added strength. They came out great and I am confident the extended tongue will keep them aligned.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald R Schultze

customer_reviews.title: Pretty pattern
customer_reviews.text: This bit cuts a profile that closely resembles the standard a wide floor moulding. It's actually just a little prettier and is designed for a 3/4 inch thick molding, as compared to the standard store moulding piece that is only 1/2 inch thick wood.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Unique long tendons and glassy smooth finish
customer_reviews.text: Undoubtedly the best router bit set on the market for making doors. I admit that I have smaller version for making cabinet doors for a couple of years. . With the long tenons as an integral part of the door they hold together even without glue. The added touch of glassy smooth cuts just adds to the ease of a completed finished door. This bit set does take some training and some practice runs but once you're set up it goes smoothly. My recommendation is put it in the router table and make some test cuts first, you will get more out of the video and instructions that way.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald P.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but 5 stars for this. Extremely well made, and the longevity of the bit is so impressive. I have put a ton of lumber through this bit for custom architecture plinth blocks. It cuts smooth every time, not one single complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Andy the Woodworker

customer_reviews.title: Good entry door bit set.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work well on a double 1-3/4” thick white oak entry door. I’m not sure how long they will last before they need to be sharpened but the shims provided on the bits came in handy, a couple small adjustments and it was a good snug fit.
customer_reviews.author: atebaul

customer_reviews.title: Good bits, but go slow with feed rate
customer_reviews.text: Bits were packed and shipped safely in a very nice plastic case, in contrast to other reviewers that had the bits just dumped in a box. Tried these out for making cabinet doors and am generally satisfied with the product. A couple of quibbles: the depth of the groove and the tongue do not seem to match exactly. I have a very small gap when viewing the joint from the end. Because of tear-out the feed rate needs to be fairly slow, especially when cutting the tongue on a stile (using a backing board helps). I found it easier to cut the tongues first, then the groove. For me it was easier to adjust my router depth in this order.
customer_reviews.author: M. McGee

customer_reviews.title: I love this bit ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bit ... a challenge to set up ... unless you know how. I calculated that the bit height should be .650" + 1/2 of the material thickness. However, that still leaves the fence. With Infinity Tools Lock Miter Master Jig Set ... both bit height and fence setting are spot on every time ... regardless of material thickness. The jig put the bit height at .998 ... the math put the bit height at 1.02 ... that is a great tolerance. This bit makes a great profile cut with very minimal chip out (what chipping did occur was caused by me feeding the material too quickly). I'm now making perfectly square humidors with ease! Thanks Freud!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: Not good Qulity
customer_reviews.text: Freud makes good saw blades but the router bits are another story. As everyone else has said packaging is bad not on Amazon's part but the manufactures. Like a lot of the other reviews bits where lose inside plastic box from Freud and yes they did have a very small chip in one of the bits. Not bad enough to send back but it still was a chip. As far as the bits them selves there ok not great. This is the only set of Freud bits I have and it will probably be the last. CMT and Whiteside are the bits I use. They may be a little pricey but the are great bits
customer_reviews.author: Cook's Custom Wood Working

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a set of Yonico bits these IMO are much better easy to setup worked flawlessly. I can always count on Freud for great mid priced/quality products!
customer_reviews.author: Radiant Simplicity

customer_reviews.title: Make a template to help set the height of the blades. Reference one side and don’t flip.
customer_reviews.text: Did a great job on a set of kitchen cabinet doors. Setting it up initially took some trial and error. But once set up, worked great. Towards the end of making 25 cabinets doors I could tell that the blades were not as sharp as they were when I started. I don’t know if this is normal or not. They still work fine. I’m lending them to a neighbor who is going to repeat my kitchen make over at his house. Over all, I’ve been very pleased and would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Gunn

customer_reviews.title: Works as Expected
customer_reviews.text: Makes the tongue and grove as one would expect it to. Easy to adjust to multiple thicknesses. Just follow the instructions and guidelines. Be sure to do practice runs to be sure measurements are correct.
customer_reviews.author: MA in TN

customer_reviews.title: needed a little sanding but the moulding turned out as good as in the big box store
customer_reviews.text: This bit could save you a ton of money. However, you need a heavy router table and lots of feather boards. I suggest a minimum of two pressing down, and one front and one in back. You also need a auxiliary board to support the height of the moulding. This is one tall bit and prone to chatter. Ran about 1800 ft., of oak, needed a little sanding but the moulding turned out as good as in the big box store. I also ran stock wider than needed and ripped it to the correct width. Seemed to support it better.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice ser
customer_reviews.text: But these to modify hardwood flooring for a project I was on. I actually haven’t had a chance to use them yet as I had other alternatives on the job site. But I have them for the next one
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with broken cutting teeth
customer_reviews.text: Either the quality of Freund products have really gone down or there is not longer any QC. Cutting teeth were completely broken at the edge making the mortising bit completely unusable. And in addition there 800 number does not work. I am in Ecuador paid heavy import duty on this item and am now completely stuck.
customer_reviews.author: S.K.

customer_reviews.title: Great for cut new tongue and groove in hardwood floors!
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp! Makes clean cuts in heart pine 3/4" flooring for regrooving them to different sizes. Comes with plenty of adjustment shims.
customer_reviews.author: bryanmeeks

customer_reviews.title: Worked out great.
customer_reviews.text: I had to make 22 cabinet doors due to damage and needed a finger pull bit. Looked at the profile and seemed to match what I had and ordered. Worked out great with my router table set up. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice look but difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: This router bit produces a very nice look. However, when trying to create my drawer pulls in the center of the drawer fronts (18 of them), there was a lot of tearout on exiting the cut. I tried slowing the router bit to no avail. I even tried cutting off in increments of 1/32" to a partial success. However, I still got tearout on the majority of my cuts. I thus had to rejoint each edge in order to remove the tearout. In a couple of cases I even had to use a carving chisel to achieve a nice look. There were no instructions with bit on how to use effectively and nothing to be found on the web.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Lavallee

customer_reviews.title: This sucks! Worst than the cheapest lock miter bits
customer_reviews.text: This product sucks! Couldnt even last 30 minutes of cutting until bit burned out! My cheapest bits I bought on Amazon for 15 bucks lasted me hours. I thought paying such a high price I would get better grade of metal. This bit is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Anjalika

customer_reviews.title: Ditch the table saw and invest in these bits
customer_reviews.text: Never do rail and style joints on a table saw again! This was a game changer, predictable cabinet doors over and over without much effort
customer_reviews.author: Jeff624

customer_reviews.title: Don't stick out your tongue (and groove)
customer_reviews.text: I really like the fact that these bits can be adjusted. They are sharp and work well. I didn't give these bits five stars because the instructions weren't that clear to me as to which shims I should use to make the tongue and grooves different sizes. I bought a pair if digital calipers to solve that problem. Sharp and adjustable. Good bits.
customer_reviews.author: J Ayers

customer_reviews.title: Smoothest cutting bit I have
customer_reviews.text: I have a number of router bits that I use for edge detail, coving, etc. This bit cut smoother than I had expected. Freud is more expensive then other brands I generally buy, but the quality really is much better. This was the only bit I could find that would match the trim cut in my home, so I only bought it for that reason. I was very pleasantly surprised at how well it performed.
customer_reviews.author: Efinity Technologies

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product
customer_reviews.text: Have used these in the past two weeks to make 12 cabinet doors. Easy to use. Precision quality makes for a good fitting stile and rail. Used them on maple and they cut very smooth as long as I did my part with smooth steady pressure when cutting the pattern. Highly recommend Freud bits!
customer_reviews.author: Big G

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing so far.
customer_reviews.text: Like most of the bad reviews for this product when it arrived one of the bits was loose in the box. Both cutters on the bit were damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Once set up, does a good job.
customer_reviews.text: Having used several times on different types of wood, the results have always been good. It does take a bit of time to set up, but once done, all goes well. Good clean cut. I do use these cutter in a router mounted in a table.
customer_reviews.author: Spoon

customer_reviews.title: Freud - EXCELLENT as ALWAYS
customer_reviews.text: Arrived next day (I have Prime/2 day delivery). Product package was protected in "plastic air pillows" in perfect condition. Freund apparantly got the "word" regarding their earlier packaging problemsa - 'Cause the cutters were firmly secured in holders in the product package - And were in perfect condition. Took some careful effort to remove/replace the cutters from/to the package holders. Shims are not marked - But the instructions show the number provided of each size - So just laying them out by the different sizes made it fairly easy to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Joe

customer_reviews.title: Cuts well but a pain...
customer_reviews.text: The bits cut beautifully but the issue was the bits are not matched. Simplicity says that if you use a certain number of spacers to cut the groove then you should be able to transfer those to the tongue cutter. Not the case. You have to mess with the washers until they fit. If you have the time to mess with the fit of each cut then these are for you. I dont have a half hour each time I change bits to fiddle with them. Returns thankfully was pain free.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Comes in very sharp... Note: you still have to set up the height from one bit to another to align the tongue and groove
customer_reviews.author: BCM

customer_reviews.title: Great bitd
customer_reviews.text: Working really well as we're replicating some kitchen cabinets. Smooth and sharp. Clean cutting and cheaper than woodworking specially stores.
customer_reviews.author: kkh2012

customer_reviews.title: I wish they were more clear about the cut depth ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish they were more clear about the cut depth. I cut all of my rails to accomodate a 1/2 inch tenon. Found out the hard way it only cuts a 7/16 mortise and tenon so now I have to re-cut all of my rails. They should make this information clear in their description. Is anyone allowed to just go in and answer the questions?? Thats the only place I could find information regarding the cut depth, and it was incorrect.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Bala

customer_reviews.title: Perfect results on the first try, sharp cutters
customer_reviews.text: I run a custom furniture and cabinet shop and bought this set to make kitchen cabinets for a client who wanted the Shaker look. I downloaded the detailed instructions from Freud's website, removed shims from both the stile cutter and rail cutter to accommodate the 7/32" walnut plywood I was using for the panels, and achieved perfect results on the first try. The cutters are super sharp and produced very clean cuts; the profile is crisp and the stiles and rails mated perfectly. I would certainly buy this set again.
customer_reviews.author: R. Light

customer_reviews.title: Nice fair priced set of bits for tongue and groove
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Fair price compared to other similar bits. Just made 2 shaker style cabinet doors and worked perfect. Used 2hp router mounted to router table.
customer_reviews.author: William L

customer_reviews.title: The off the tool finish is perfect. I bought these to run several hundred feet ...
customer_reviews.text: I have dozens of Quadra-Cut bits from Freud. The off the tool finish is perfect. I bought these to run several hundred feet of hard maple trim for cabinets, door and base moldings. The last piece is as good as the first, smooth and chatter free.
customer_reviews.author: M. Timmins

customer_reviews.title: Terrible packaging. Mad husband.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and instantly he was disappointed. Both bits came loose in the plastic case they came in and the cutters are damaged. These are poorly packaged from Freud. I will not buy Freud router bits again.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Boehnlein

customer_reviews.title: Worked great - build several cabinet doors
customer_reviews.text: This Freud set was purchased to build some cabinet doors as I was copying some existing cabinet doors in order to make new cabinets for an expanded kitchen. The set worked fine, even to the point that I drove these rail and stile bits with a slightly underpowered (1.75hp) router and used an external speed controller. Next time that I use them I hope to be using a more powerful router. These bits worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: rebelbuc

customer_reviews.title: Cuts good. Excellent bits especially for the price point
customer_reviews.text: Badass bits!!! Come with multiple thin .004 washers to adjust both bits. Cuts good. Excellent bits especially for the price point!!! Don’t mind my non-precise dept settings lol. Look at the cut quality. It’s good. Making 25 cabinet doors with it so about 300 cuts total. Still sharp
customer_reviews.author: Eric Parrow

customer_reviews.title: Bit held great while routing about 200 linear feet of white oak
customer_reviews.text: This bit is a beast and removes a lot of material. If you're routing hardwood, I suggest you get your fence depth set using a scrap piece soft wood first, then add shims to your fence and run your stock through in several passes, removing one shim at a time until you get to final depth. Bit held great while routing about 200 linear feet of white oak.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Kiernan

customer_reviews.title: Real time saver and bits matched profile perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Works great for windows too A bit too early to give 5 stars for longevity but so far one window out of poplar and still sharp like new. Also thought the items were a bit pricey but did save me a bunch of time and still have a few more to make so was worth it for me.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: You pay for what you get
customer_reviews.text: Didn't expect less from Freud. Very happy... Awesome that you can adjust to your needs
customer_reviews.author: Joe K

customer_reviews.title: Freud Drawer Lock Bit
customer_reviews.text: Takes some set-up. There is some help with this online and it pays to find it. Perhaps I'm a bit too picky with the set-up but after about an hour, I got it perfect. Saved my test pieces for easy set-up next time around. Smooth cutting cuter, run at finished height and depth on first pass with no problem. Great bit.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: This two arbor set is easily adjusted up to the claimed 1 1/4" board thickness ...
customer_reviews.text: This beefy bit set costs more than others, but in this case, you actually do get what you pay for. This two arbor set is easily adjusted up to the claimed 1 1/4" board thickness with the included shim washer set (and a few other washers of my own). As an engineer, I appreciate the design and effectiveness of the unique tear out reduction feature (something not illustrated in the posted pictures). Don't try to use something like this bit in a hand held router. In a router table, a serious set of hold downs will avoid grief (I use ball bearing, adjustable tension "Board Buddies"). Mark Singer
customer_reviews.author: Mark Singer

customer_reviews.title: The large 2" diameter makes a difference when cutting the joint in the drawer front.
customer_reviews.text: This is the one you are looking for. Typical Freud high quality cutter. When used to cut deeply into the drawer front, say to provide clearance for a typical 1/2" drawer slide, use a dado head on the table saw to remove most of the waste wood and ease the job of the router bit.
customer_reviews.author: Poppa Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great value - high quality parts that last.
customer_reviews.text: Great set. Plenty of versatility and the bits cut cleanly. I made 25 cabinet doors and they are still sharp as a whistle. I also figured out how to made thin inside rails to use for a door with glass panels. See included pic.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: Great bit!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Making my own base board. Cuts mdf in one take on 2-1/4 horse router. Very smooth finish.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla M.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This was the very first router bit I've ever used with my new router (Bosch 1617EVSPK). Although I made common rookie mistakes, I was completely pleased with how well it formed my 3/4 inch poplar boards used to replace the ones my dog chewed. I used the bit with a routing table and had some elevation issues at first, but once it was set just right it formed a perfect edge. I look forward to using it for other jobs in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin G. Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product But Be Patient
customer_reviews.text: You need to take SMALL bites with this bit, make a sacrificial blank to practice with, make sure you don't exceed the recommended speed, and work patiently! If you follow these guidelines you are rewarded with a beautiful, clean, accurate raised panel that looks like you bought it at the millwork shop. I highly recommend this bit BUT only to woodworkers with the patience to learn how to use it properly!
customer_reviews.author: TC3

customer_reviews.title: Is a quality addition to the bit box
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these bits to finish the edge on our solid oak cupboard doors. Definatly another quality product from Freud. It has remained sharp, even the end grain cuts are smooth and easily finished. A major key to any bit this size is power. My router is the Freud 3.25 hp and this bit makes it growl under load. I dialed down the router speed, control the feed and this bit just keeps on cutting. Now all I need is the same size and features in a 15 degree angle and I wouldn't have so much grief with the hinges!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best router bits I have ever used. Easy to set up and cuts perfectly smoothly. If you want shaker style doors that come out perfectly, this is the bit set for you. I have tried other brands of router bits but I am never disappointed when I use Freud.
customer_reviews.author: James Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: High quality bits! Just completed 1000 board feet of ash flooring. The last piece cut just as well as the first.
customer_reviews.author: phil

customer_reviews.title: Very good.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these while making my kitchen cabinets. They are excellent as one would expect from Freud. 27 cabinet doors so far and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: LO

customer_reviews.title: This is not only a beautiful set of bits that work extremely well
customer_reviews.text: This is not only a beautiful set of bits that work extremely well, but it comes with a handy storage case and it comes with an excellent training disc and printed instructions. The one thing to watch for is that this is for entry and interior doors, and it comes set for entry which 1-5/8". You will need to spend a little time resetting it to 1-3/8", and you will want to follow the printed directions closely if y ou are making extended tenons.
customer_reviews.author: The OT Man

customer_reviews.title: Essential for every woodshop with a router table
customer_reviews.text: 😍😍😍😍😍 love this set. Adjusts easily and cuts perfect interlocking sections with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Houghton

customer_reviews.title: Great bits!
customer_reviews.text: These bits were amazingly easy to use. I was quickly making repeated doors. I was a bit surprised that I needed to add a shim to get the proper fit for 3/4" boards. I would think they would be set up for that by default. The shims come in a little box with the bits, but they can slide out easily after you open the little plastic baggie they are in, so be careful not to lose them.
customer_reviews.author: othervoice

customer_reviews.title: A good buy...
customer_reviews.text: I've always had good experience with Freud router bits. Good value for the price
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I had wanted. Everyone is right.. the setup took me about an hour + to get it perfect (USE SCRAP of the same material or your setup process will be useless) and if you're going to use material of the same thickness often, keep the scrap where the bit & fence were set correctly as an easy guide for the next time. The bit was actually much larger than I had anticipated and was a little intimidating once I fired up the router but it worked great with the solid walnut I was using. Tried to post a photo of my miter but can't figure out how to.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: A good bit
customer_reviews.text: Like most Freud bits, it's a good bit and better than most.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G.

customer_reviews.title: Here's my two bits (hehehe)
customer_reviews.text: I have found that the packaging that Amazon does is perfectly fine; the internal packaging by Freud leaves something to be desired and allows for the possiblity of chipping in transit. The adjustability of both these bits is amazing; that, I believe is unique on the market, and is an important feature when dealing with various thicknesses of plywood on different projects. Also allows you to set the tightness of the joint to your own preference. As a negative, I found that the slot cutter chewed up my cherry wood on one side somewhat, and I never did figure where the blame should be laid. Other than that, I was pleased with these bits.
customer_reviews.author: Woodworker

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again if they ever ware out
customer_reviews.text: Used to build my first ever rail and stile cabinet doors. Worked excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Paul T.

customer_reviews.title: No Hassle Edge Routing
customer_reviews.text: I used this bit on a 17" x 84" x 1" thick Poplar table top. Using a hand held router w/edge guide the first cut was on end grain. The shear angle and quadra cut design of the Freud bit resulted in a very smooth cut with no tearout or burning. The final depth of cut was acheived with two passes. The hand held router was used as the table top was too large and cumbersom to use the table mounted router in my small shop. I purchased the bit from Amazon as it was not readily available locally. Amazon delivered and I was able to meet my customers delivery date.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence F. Grundy

customer_reviews.title: once again, freud doesn’t disappoint
customer_reviews.text: i used this set for making shaker style cabinet doors. I was hesitant due to my experience making stiles & rails on a shaper. this was a completely different experience. the cuts were smooth and accurate. even the tongue of the stile (crosscut) was smooth. i highly recommend this set. since freud makes their own carbide for each of their products its as good as you can get.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Ronco

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Set Up = Perfect Results
customer_reviews.text: When coupled with Sommerfeld's "East Set-Up Jig" this bit produces flawless and amazingly strong joints. Yes, in part that extra strength is due to the additional gluing surface but also too, there is an inherent shear force imputed by nesting the pieces together. Beautiful and functional and Freud has never disappointed me. Vibration free and amazingly sharp carbide. Five stars for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Terry C.

customer_reviews.title: Not possible to replace parts as they wear out or are damaged.
customer_reviews.text: Freud does not sell ANY replacement parts for this set, not even the individual bits themselves. If you damage any component of this set, which includes 22 different pieces, you're SOL. Extremely disappointed this expensive router bit set is not serviceable in any way.
customer_reviews.author: lovelabs

customer_reviews.title: Versatile with quality components
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bit with quality components. Versatile for many different panel thicknesses.
customer_reviews.author: Rick H

customer_reviews.title: Solid quality and clean cutting...
customer_reviews.text: This was my first experience with freud bits and they are definitely solid. I custom made the wainscot for my dining room out of poplar using this bit - first time doing such a thing and it came out great. I ran a lot of wood through it (bosch router + bit) and it held up perfectly. The fact that the bit cuts a shape that can be interlocked saves on having to have two separate bits, a definite plus. As far as working with it, once you get the height set you are off and shaping.
customer_reviews.author: SuperflyDIY

customer_reviews.title: a very good bit
customer_reviews.text: ROBERT uses the bits and HE is well satisfied .after setting them up He showed the work to me and the results were just as good as making them on the table saw .these bits will save us a lot of time by freeing up the table saw for cutting dimensional work .We are well satisfied with the bits .the set up was a little slow but it will get faster as we mark the spacers
customer_reviews.author: Hazel Pollock

product_meta.title: Freud 1-3/4" (Dia.) Adjustable Tongue & Groove Bit Set with 1/2" Shank (99-036)
product_meta.description:
Style:Adjustable Tongue and Groove Router Bit Set, 1/2-Inch ShankExclusive Freud design features a tongue cutter with opposing shear angles to ensure a flawless finish.

AMAZON.COM
The Freud Difference
Freud manufactures some of the most innovative, technologically advanced saw blades in the world. To ensure that the highest quality products meet the toughest design standards, Freud owns and operates six manufacturing facilities in Western Europe. Freud is one of the few manufacturers of woodworking tools in the world that produces its own MicroGrain carbide with titanium, called TiCo -- a combination of titanium and cobalt. Freud develops different types of carbide for each application to maximize the cutting life and performance of the tool; and Freud also operates one of the most modern product development research centers in Europe. By overseeing the entire manufacturing process from start to finish, Freud guarantees some of the highest quality, most advanced products in the industry. 

 About Freud's Industrial Bits
Serious woodworkers choose serious accessories. They choose Freud. The Freud name equals quality, precision and craftsmanship. Freud router bits feature TiCo Hi-Density Carbide for maximum cutting life and are individually balanced; providing a cut above the rest. When you’re looking for a serious router bit, look for Freud red. 

 About this Adjustable Tongue and Groove Bit Set
Freud's adjustable tongue and groove bit set is ideal for producing perfectly fitted tongue and groove joints. Freud's exclusive design features a tongue cutter with opposing shear angles to ensure a flawless finish. These bits are adjustable at .002-inch increments for stock thickness of 1/2 to 1-1/4-inch, and groove widths of 7/32 to 3/8-inch. The tongue bit diameter is 1-3/4-inch, 7/32-3/8-inch carbide height, 1/2-inch shank, 3-1/4 inches overall. Groove bit diameter 1-3/4-inch, 13/16-inch 1-11/32-inch carbide height, 1/2-inch shank, 2-11/16 inches overall. 

 Applications
Use this set to produce perfectly fitted tongue and groove joints for projects such as Shaker style cabinet doors. These bits cut all composition materials, plywoods, hardwoods, and softwoods. They are designed for use with table-mounted portable routers. 

 Warranty
These bits are covered by Freud's limited lifetime warranty.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Freud's adjustable tongue & groove bit set is ideal for producing perfectly fitted tongue and groove joints for projects such as Shaker style cabinet doors. Freud's exclusive design features a tongue cutter with opposing shear angles to ensure a flawless finish. Tongue bit diameter 1 3/4-Inch, 7/32-3/8-Inch carbide height, 1/2-Inch shank, 3 1/4-Inch overall. Groove bit diameter 1 3/4-Inch, 13/16-Inch 1 11/32-Inch carbide height, 1/2-Inch shank, 2 11/16-Inch overall.

See more
feature_bullets: Overall Dia. (D) 1-3/4", bearing Dia. 7/8", carbide height (h) tongue bit: 13/16" - 1-11/32", Groove bit: 7/32" - 3/8", 1/2" Shank
Adjustable at .002 inch increments for stock thickness of 1/2" To 1-1/4" And groove widths of 7/32" To 3/8"
Cuts all composition materials, plywood's, hardwoods, and softwoods
